description: From Hebrew כָּף‎ (kaf, “kaph”), from Proto-Semitic *kapp- (“palm, hand”) (Akkadian 𒀉 (kappu(m)), Hebrew כַּף‎ (kaf, “hand/foot”), Arabic كَفّ‎ (kaff), Ugaritic 𐎋𐎔 (kp)) Doublet of kappa.

entries.meaning: The eleventh letter of many Semitic alphabets/abjads (Phoenician, Aramaic, Hebrew, Syriac, Arabic and others).
